message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.HC, cs.RO

The paper deals with real-time 3D facial performance capture using RGB-D sensors, which involves computer vision (CV) and graphics (GR) techniques. The method is based on a self-supervised deep learning framework, which falls under multimedia (MM) and human-computer interaction (HC) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper involves designing a loss function and incorporating temporal coherence and same identity constraints, which are related to robotics (RO) sub-category. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.CV and cs.GR, followed by cs.MM, cs.HC, and cs.RO.
